    • Constructor Detail

      • Investment

        public Investment(java.lang.String symbol,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  int quantity,
                  double price,
                  double bookValue)
           throws PortfolioException
        Initializing stocks calls the set function for stocks
        Parameters:
        symbol - contains the symbol of the stock/mutualfund
        name - contains the name of the stock/mutualfund
        quantity - contains the quantity of the stock/mutualfund
        price - contains the price of the stock/mutualfund
        bookValue - contains the bookValue of the stock/mutualfund
        Throws:
        PortfolioException

      • setStocks

        public void setStocks(java.lang.String symbol,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      int quantity,
                      double price,
                      double bookValue)
               throws PortfolioException
        Sets the stocks Gets variable from user and inputs it into the stock array element
        Parameters:
        symbol, - name, quantity, price, bookValue : used to set all the variables in the current instance of the object investment!
        name - name that the user wants to set for the stocks
        quantity - quantity of the stocks user will set
        price - price of the stock user will set
        bookValue - bookValue of the stock user will set
        Throws:
        PortfolioException
